351.title: Dad convinced his doctor that he needed 2 drinks at night to sleep: Ranbir
351.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed his father, late actor Rishi Kapoor had the habit of having two drinks every night. Ranbir added that during the early stages of his cancer treatment in the US, he was worried about this routine being disrupted. "He tricked his doctor claiming...he wasn't able to sleep at night and as...remedy, he'd chug down two drinks," Ranbir said.

352.title: Can't deny adoption rights just because man is Muslim: Delhi court
352.article_body: A court in Delhi has granted custody parole to a Muslim prisoner so as to allow him to go sign adoption papers in Haryana. The court observed that the man can't be denied adoption rights just because he's a Muslim. The prosecution had opposed the parole claiming that Muslims can't adopt a child as it's not legally permissible in Islam.

353.title: It's my personal life and I don't like to discuss it: Taapsee on marriage plans
353.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, when asked about marriage plans, said she does not like to discuss her personal life. She also joked about wearing three rings. "In that case, I should be engaged to three people," Taapsee added. She further said she eats in accordance with weather. "Wherever I go...I tell the hotel staff...about my meals...they serve me accordingly," she added.

354.title: Malaika Arora to be discharged from hospital today after car accident
354.article_body: Malaika Arora, who was admitted to Apollo Hospital in Navi Mumbai after receiving some minor injuries in a car accident on Saturday, will be discharged from the hospital today. "Malaika has minor injuries on forehead, CT scan has turned out fine and she's currently okay," the hospital said on Saturday. The accident took place when Malaika was returning from Pune.

355.title: PNB branch in Ghaziabad robbed at gunpoint; 4 flee with ₹11 lakh
355.article_body: A Punjab National Bank branch in Ghaziabad was robbed at gunpoint by four men on Saturday, said police. The perpetrators, dressed in black and wearing red masks, fled with ₹11 lakh cash. "They held the staff inside the bank (at gunpoint) and fled with the money. We are ascertaining more information through CCTV footage to identify the accused," said police.

356.title: Drug addict kills sister after argument over domestic issues in Delhi
356.article_body: A drug addict murdered his 24-year-old sister in Delhi. He killed his sister after an argument over domestic issues reportedly broke out between them. Reports said that strangulation marks were found on the victim's neck. The accused confessed to killing his sister during investigation by the police. He also said that both of them were drug addicts.

357.title: Jadeja is under pressure, CSK openers need to perform: Shastri
357.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja is under pressure after suffering consecutive defeats in their two games in the ongoing IPL season. "There's a new captain at the helm, and he's under pressure. Yes, Dhoni is in form but if one of those openers doesn't score then CSK will find it difficult," stated Shastri.

358.title: Domino’s offers free assured surprise gifts worth ₹50 crore
358.article_body: Domino's has announced that it is throwing a birthday party where it's offering surprise gifts with every order. Gifts worth ₹50 crore will be given to customers, it revealed. The free assured surprise gifts can be availed by customers on delivery, dine-in, and takeaway orders via the Domino's app or at their stores.

359.title: Growing trust in India is helping in key deals: Piyush Goyal
359.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's decisions have been able to generate a lot of goodwill for India globally, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. His statement comes as India and Australia signed the Economic Cooperation and Trade Agreement to boost economic ties. On being asked what is facilitating these trade deals, Goyal said, "Growing trust in India is helping in all such developments."

360.title: Pravin Tambe breaks down after watching his biopic with KKR team, video surfaces
360.article_body: Leg-spinner Pravin Tambe, who made his IPL debut aged 41, broke down after he watched the biopic on his life along with the KKR team. The movie 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' was released on Friday and stars Shreyas Talpade. KKR shared a video on Twitter showing Tambe breaking down. "Just never give up on your dreams...Dreams do come true," he said.

361.title: India reports 1,096 new COVID-19 cases, 81 deaths in last 24 hours
361.article_body: India has reported 1,096 new COVID-19 cases and 81 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,260 cases and 83 deaths. Out of the 81 deaths reported today, 16 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 65 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

362.title: Australia's Alyssa Healy records highest-ever score in a World Cup final
362.article_body: Australia opener Alyssa Healy has recorded the highest-ever score in a World Cup final across men's and women's cricket. The 32-year-old scored 170(138) against England in the 2022 Women's World Cup final today. She broke the previous record set by former Australian men's wicketkeeper-batter Adam Gilchrist, who had scored 149(104) against Sri Lanka in the 2007 World Cup final.

363.title: Remove mosque loudspeakers or will play Hanuman Chalisa there: Raj
363.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Saturday demanded that the Maharashtra government should remove loudspeakers at mosques and said that if this isn't done then loudspeakers will be placed outside mosques and "Hanuman Chalisa will be played at higher volume". "I'm not against prayers, you can pray at...home," he added. Moreover, he demanded that MP and MLA pensions should be stopped.

364.title: Drug trafficker sentenced to 14 yrs in prison by Bahraich court
364.article_body: A Nepal-based drug trafficker, who was arrested by NCB nearly five years ago, was sentenced to 14 years of rigorous imprisonment by a local court in Bahraich, NCB officials said. The court has imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on him and in case of non-payment of the fine, he will have to remain in prison for two more years.

365.title: Ghaziabad reverses order banning meat sale during Navratri
365.article_body: A day after imposing a ban on sale of raw meat during Navratri from April 2 to 10, the Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam reversed the order. In a fresh notification issued on Saturday, the mayor said the regulations by the state government would be followed. The officials said that no such ban has been ordered by the UP government so far.

366.title: Wearing mask is always safer: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray
366.article_body: On the first day of the removal of COVID-19 restrictions in Maharashtra, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday urged people to follow the mask advisory. "Wearing a mask is always safer, don’t feel awkward wearing one for your own safety," Aaditya said. Recently, the Maharashtra government announced that wearing masks is no longer compulsory in the state.

367.title: Chandigarh allows restaurants, bars and hotels to stay open till 3 am
367.article_body: Under Chandigarh's new excise policy, restaurants, bars and hotels in the Union Territory can remain open till 3 am. "The facility of two-hour extension in closure timings [will be] given to restaurants, bars and hotels on payment of additional license fees," an official release stated. Low-alcoholic drinks, including beer and wine, have been exempted from license fees and taxes.

368.title: How can he die suddenly?: Maharashtra minister on Aryan Khan drug case witness
368.article_body: The death of Prabhakar Sail, an independent witness in the drugs-on-cruise case involving Aryan Khan, will be investigated by Maharashtra Police, said the state Home Minister, Dilip Walse Patil. He said people were wondering how "such a strong man could die of a heart attack so suddenly". The minister asked the Director General of Police to investigate Sail's death.

369.title: Broadway's Macbeth performances cancelled after Craig tests COVID +ve
369.article_body: Two performances of Macbeth on Broadway have been cancelled after Daniel Craig tested positive for COVID-19, a statement on the production's official Twitter account read. "We apologise for the inconvenience this causes ticket holders, but the safety of our audiences, the cast and crew remains our top priority," it added. The 54-year-old actor stars in the play opposite Ruth Negga.

370.title: Suspecting wife's extramarital affair, Hyd man kills minor daughter, self
370.article_body: A 40-year-old man died by suicide after killing his six-year-old daughter in Hyderabad. Reports said that the man suspected his wife of having an extramarital affair. The man had checked into a lodge with his daughter where he killed her and later died by suicide. His wife had expressed desire to move to Canada for her career after leaving job.

371.title: Did 'chhichhora' roles before Beta; cried when I was offered the film: Aruna
371.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani, who played Anil Kapoor's on-screen mother, Lakshmi Devi, in 'Beta' recalled that it was difficult for her to bag the role in the film even though it was helmed by her brother, Indra Kumar. Aruna added that she cried a lot after she bagged the role. "Before 'Beta', I used to do only chhichhora roles," she said.

372.title: GT's total was not so big, we could've batted better: Pant after defeat
372.article_body: After their 14-run defeat, DC captain Rishabh Pant said GT's 171-run total was not "so big" and they could've batted batter in the game. "[During] the powerplay, we lost three wickets, then in the middle overs we lost three wickets...every match is going to be hard to come back after losing so many wickets," he stated. Pant scored 43(29).

373.title: 16-yr-old booked for filming home tutor in bathroom in Pune
373.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Pune has been booked for recording videos of his English home tutor while she was in the bathroom. The boy was arrested and sent to the District Women and Child Welfare Committee for counselling. "He had developed isolation symptoms during the lockdown period which had a significant impact on his mental state," said police.

374.title: Man, 5-yr-old son accidentally locked up at bank in Punjab; rescued
374.article_body: A man and his five-year-old son who had gotten accidentally locked up at a bank in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday were rescued after about two and a half hours. The father-son duo had come to the bank to deposit some cash. The man claimed he'd called out to the officials when they were pulling down the shutter, but was "ignored".

375.title: 20-yr-old youth arrested for killing his mother's 47-yr-old lover in Mumbai
375.article_body: A 20-year-old youth has been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly killing his mother's 47-year-old lover, police said. The incident took place when the accused reached home and found the victim and his mother together. Police added that an argument took place between them and in a fit of rage the youth took a kitchen knife and stabbed the victim.

376.title: DC were ahead till Rishabh was there, but Lockie changed the game: Hardik
376.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya praised pacer Lockie Ferguson for "changing the things" in their game against DC, which they won by 14 runs. Chasing 172 to win, DC were 118/4 in when Lockie dismissed Rishabh Pant and Axar Patel in the 15th over. "Till Rishabh was there...DC were ahead [but] that over really turned it for us," stated Hardik.

377.title: I had no one to talk to, I was depressed for a month: Rohit on World Cup 2011 snub
377.article_body: Talking about not being picked for World Cup 2011 in an interaction with Jemimah Rodrigues, India captain Rohit Sharma said he got the news when he was playing a series in South Africa. "I had no one to talk to at that point. I was just sitting in my room," he stated. Rohit added he was depressed for a month.

378.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 11th time in 13 days
378.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 11th time in 13 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹103.41/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹94.67/litre from ₹93.87/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹118.41/litre from ₹117.57/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹102.64/litre from ₹101.79/litre.

379.title: Sri Lanka blocks social media platforms after citizens plan protests against govt
379.article_body: Sri Lanka has blocked social media platforms after reports emerged that citizens were planning to launch protests over economic crisis all over the island despite the curfew. Facebook, Facebook Messenger, Twitter, WhatsApp, YouTube, Snapchat, Twitter Periscope, Google Video, TikTok, Viber, Telegram and Instagram have not been working, reports claimed. Sri Lanka has declared a public emergency.

380.title: My walk is like a duck; had to work hard to bring swag in 'Gangubai...': Alia
380.article_body: Alia Bhatt said her walk in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has a lot of "swag" and she had to work hard for it. "When I watch my own paparazzi videos, I feel like I walk strangely, like a duck. I had to make it more interesting," she added. Alia said she was inspired by Allu Arjun's swag in 'Pushpa' for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'.

381.title: Bengaluru boy makes hoax bomb call to rly police over PUBG partner
381.article_body: A 12-year-old boy allegedly made a hoax bomb threat call to Railway police helpline to stop his classmate from boarding a train as he'd lose his PUBG partner and would have to stop playing. The boy had called around 2 pm on March 30 claiming that there was a bomb at Yelahanka railway station, causing its closure for 90 minutes.

382.title: PMC starts collecting ₹50 daily from illegal hawkers on roads
382.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has started collecting ₹50 daily from roadside hawkers doing business illegally from April 1. The money will be used for the purpose of garbage collection and administrative work. "These illegal hawkers use the public space and often surround it with garbage which is later supposed to be cleaned up by the PMC," said an official.

383.title: Mysterious lights spotted in sky in Maharashtra, MP, Gujarat; pics go viral
383.article_body: People in Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat witnessed mysterious trail of lights in the sky on Saturday. Astronomer Jonathan McDowell referred to the event seen over the states as a possible "re-entry of a Chinese rocket stage" that was launched in February 2021. Several experts also speculated that event could be a "meteor shower".

384.title: 42-year-old man killed, his body hanged from iron pipe in Pune
384.article_body: An unidentified person has been booked after a 42-year-old man was allegedly killed and then his body was hanged from an iron pipe to pass it off as suicide in Pune. A post-mortem report revealed that the deceased, whose body was found on Friday, died due to strangulation and head injury. An investigation is on to identify the accused.

385.title: Delhi policeman out with family attacked with knife for scolding man for rash driving
385.article_body: A Delhi Police sub-inspector who was out with his wife and two-year-old daughter was attacked with a knife after he confronted and scolded a man for driving rashly in a local market in Delhi. The policeman had asked the man to drive properly, following which the driver misbehaved with him, an officer said. An FIR was registered in this connection.

386.title: Hyd man demands action against man smoking near temple, police respond
386.article_body: A Twitter user asked Hyderabad Police on Saturday to take action against another man who allegedly refused to stop smoking near a temple when he was asked to do so. "He simply replied...'I'm not afraid of anyone'...Can we have any anti squad team for taking...action against...such things," the user wrote. Hyderabad Police asked him to share location of the incident.

387.title: Tesla delivers record 3,10,048 cars in Q1 as Musk calls it 'difficult quarter'
387.article_body: Tesla reported that it delivered record number of electric vehicles in the first quarter of 2022, despite ongoing supply chain challenges and factory shutdowns. Tesla said it delivered 3,10,048 vehicles during the first three months of this year. "This was an exceptionally difficult quarter due to supply chain interruptions & China's Zero COVID policy," Tesla's billionaire CEO Elon Musk said.

388.title: People may have lost their mind: Binance's billionaire CEO on NFT craze
388.article_body: Crypto exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao, speaking about the NFT craze, said, "People may have lost their mind." Referring to the NFT artwork which sold for $69.3 million last year, Zhao asked, "Nothing is worth that much, right?" The billionaire added that NFTs (non-fungible tokens) allow artists to monetise their work globally again and reach a much wider audience.

389.title: GT defeat DC to record 2nd win in a row, Shubman smashes his highest T20 score
389.article_body: GT defeated DC by 14 runs to register their second win a row in IPL 2022. The match witnessed GT opener Shubman Gill smash his highest score in T20s. Shubman scored 84 runs off 46 deliveries to help GT put up a total of 171/6. GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson took four wickets as DC managed 157/9 in 20 overs.

390.title: 50 cattle being illegally transported recovered by Assam Police
390.article_body: The Assam Police on Friday recovered 50 cattle that were allegedly being illegally transported in two vehicles and arrested one person in connection with the incident. The cattle were being taken from Upper Assam to Nagaon. Sharing pictures of the cattle on Twitter, police wrote, "Two cattle vehicles were apprehended by Nagaon Police at Jajori PS and Borghat PP."

391.title: PM Modi extends greetings on commencement of Ramzan
391.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday conveyed his greetings on the commencement of Ramzan. "May this holy month inspire people to serve the poor. May it also further enhance the spirit of peace, harmony and compassion in our society," he said. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi also tweeted, "Ramzan Mubarak! May this pious month bring good health, peace and prosperity to all."

392.title: 2 arrested in HP's Shimla for consuming heroin near hospital gate
392.article_body: Two people, allegedly consuming heroin outside the Indira Gandhi Medical College and Hospital's (IGMC) gate in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, were arrested by the police's Special Investigation Unit on Saturday. Police said that around 4.02 grams of the drug were also recovered from their possession. A case has been registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, police added.

393.title: Pakistan win an ODI series against Australia in 20 years
393.article_body: Pakistan beat Australia by nine wickets in third and final ODI in Lahore to clinch the three-match series 2-1. Haris Rauf's 3/39 and Mohammad Wasim's 3/40 helped Pakistan restrict Australia at 210, while an unbeaten 190-run second-wicket stand between skipper Babar Azam (105*) and Imam-ul-Haq's (89*) helped hosts win. It's Pakistan's first ODI series win against Australia in 20 years.

394.title: Sachin paaji said 'Build a partnership' as I walked in after his wicket: Kohli on WC final
394.article_body: Recalling 2011 World Cup final, which India won by defeating Sri Lanka on April 2, 2011, Virat Kohli said, "I remember the pressure of walking in to bat at two down...Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag...both were out." He added, "When I walked in...Sachin paaji said, 'Build a partnership'. We did build a partnership, me and Gautam Gambhir."

395.title: Move to the streets in interest of nation: Pak PM a day ahead of no-trust vote
395.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Saturday told people to take to the streets, a day ahead of the scheduled vote on the no-confidence motion tabled against him in the National Assembly. "You should do so (protest on the streets) for your conscience, in the interest of this nation," said Khan, during a Q&A session with the Pakistani public.

396.title: Retreating Russian troops planting mines in northern Ukraine: Prez
396.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday accused Russian forces of deliberately mining areas in northern Ukraine during their retreat from the region. "They are mining all this territory. Houses are mined, equipment is mined, even the bodies of dead people," he said. The retreat comes after Russia announced this week it would scale down military operations around Kyiv and Chernihiv.

397.title: 1st Kayaking & Canoeing marathon held on river Jhelum in J&K's Srinagar
397.article_body: The first-ever Kayaking and Canoeing marathon was held in J&K's Srinagar on Saturday. The marathon started from the Zero Bridge to Habba Kadal bridge on the Jhelum river. This event was organised as a part of 'My Youth, My Pride', J&K Sports Council Secretary, Nuzhat Gul, said, adding, "I urge...society to join hands and help keep...youths away from drugs."

398.title: Power regulator caps prices at ₹12/unit at exchanges amid rising demand
398.article_body:
The Central Electricity Regulatory Commission has asked the electricity exchanges to cap prices at 
₹12 per unit amid a surge in power demand. The power regulator said prices at power exchanges have remained "significantly" higher during the last few days. "Abnormally high price...is not only against consumer interest but also erodes the buyer's confidence in the market's credibility," it added.

399.title: Pakistan's Babar Azam creates history, becomes fastest batter to reach 16 ODI hundreds
399.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has created history by becoming the fastest batter to reach 16 hundreds in ODI cricket, achieving the feat during the third ODI against Australia in Lahore. The 27-year-old batter reached the milestone in his 84th ODI innings. The previous record was held by ex-South Africa batter Hashim Amla, who reached 16 hundreds in 94 ODI innings.

400.title: We tried everything but couldn't get him out: Rohit on Buttler's ton
400.article_body: Referring to Jos Buttler's 68-ball 100 against MI in IPL 2022, five-time champions MI's skipper Rohit Sharma said the RR opener played an "exceptional" innings. "We tried everything but we could not get him out. But, he played really well," he added. Notably, it's the first century of this season's IPL. MI have two losses from two matches so far.
